Our Founders

CREST’s founders are all educators specializing in special needs learning, including experience in the classroom and school administration.

Dawn O’Connor
Dawn is the former CEO of a non-profit, non-public school serving over 200 special education students in the Southern California area. Dawn is also a fully credentialed teacher in both regular and special education. She also holds an Administrative Credential and has over 45 years’ experience in non-public school administration and teaching.

Malena Clements
Dawn is the former CEO of a non-profit, non-public school serving over 200 special education Malena is a former vice principal of a non-profit, non-public school serving over 200 special education students in the Southern California area. Malena is also a fully credentialed teacher in both regular and special education. Malena brings over 20 years’ experience in non-public school teaching and school administration.

Virginia “Gina” Prado
Dawn is the former CEO of a non-profit, non-public school serving over 200 special education Gina is a former vice principal of a non-profit, non-public school serving over 200 special education students in the Southern California area. Gina is also a fully credentialed teacher in both regular and special education. She is a Board Certified Behavior Analyst and holds an Administrative Credential and brings 35+ years’ experience in non-public school teaching and school administration.

Harriet Hasson
Dawn is the former CEO of a non-profit, non-public school serving over 200 special education Harriet is a former vice principal of a non-profit, non-public school serving over 200 special education students in the Southern California area. Harriet is also a fully credentialed teacher in both regular and special education. Harriet comes to CREST with over 25 years’ experience in non-public school teaching and school administration.
